bibl.title: Letter from Florence M. Read to Laura Armistead Carter, October 29, 1924

div1.p: Read discusses payment for Henry Carter's book on yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Florence M. Read to Laura Armistead Carter, October 29, 1924
div1.opener:
Book, Expenses
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
----
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
MEMBERS
----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
JOHN G. FITZGERALD
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
OF
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “INTERCOM”
29 October, 1924.
My dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
Isn't it time that you sent us another
statement about your father's work on the “History
of Yellow Fever,” It seems to me that he has
been paid for very little time during 1924. We
count on you to let us know when payments should
be met.
div1.closer:
Yours very sincerely, Florence M. Read Miss Laura Carter,
2122 California Street, N.W.,
Washington, D. C.
FMR:BR
